intro: Jacquemontia grisea, commonly known as the gray jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other vine-like plants. The plant produces showy, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Jacquemontia grisea is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
